Microsoft (MSFT) is expected to release Q2 fiscal 2022 earnings on 01/25/2022 after the bell. Consensus earnings-per-share (EPS) is $2.32, 👉 slightly ahead of normalized Q1 FY22 actual earnings of $2.27. Q1 FY22 earnings beat estimates by $0.19 per share. 

https://www.google.com/amp/s/seekingalpha.com/amp/article/4480146-microsoft-stock-buy-sell-upcoming-earnings

 $TSLA  1/26 AH

This earning could present great trading setups with the volatility or great dip buying opportunities on good companies.

links.title: Two years since Covid was first confirmed in U.S., the pandemic is worse than anyone imagined
links.description: A 35-year-old man returned to the U.S. from Wuhan, China on Jan. 15, 2020 and fell ill with a cough and fever. He had read an alert from the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention about an outbreak of a novel coronavirus in Wuhan and sought treatment at an urgent care clinic in Snohomish County, Washington four days later.

body: $QQQ $SPY $AAPL $AMD  I bet the Kansas City Chiefs fans aren't complaining about the overtime Rule now like they did in 2018.

Warehouse workers have for years worried about automation and robots taking their jobs. And with the Covid-19 pandemic, a number of factories across the country have increased their reliance on technology, a trend that's likely to benefit tech-solutions providers like Honeywell ($HON). 
 
Large companies, such as Nike ($NKE), Nestlé and Apple ($AAPL) have all publicly talked about the need to make manufacturing more efficient, aided in part by automation and robots. In a September interview with the Financial Times, Thomas Evans, robotics chief technology officer for Honeywell, said there was an "upward trend" throughout 2021, one that is likely to continue for "the years beyond." In the past year, Honeywell (HON) has boosted its warehouse automation revenue 14% to $2 billion. 
 
 
https://seekingalpha.com/news/3790347-honeywell-could-benefit-as-warehouses-increase-use-of-robots-automation 
 
$BGRY

links.title: Welcome robot masters: Honeywell could gain as warehouse automation grows
